required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Retinal Vascular Changes After Ocular Blunt Trauma
clinical_study.official_title: Retinal Vascular Features in Ocular Blunt Trauma by Optical Coherence Tomography Angiography

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the retinal vascular features using optical coherence tomography angiography in patients that received ocular blunt trauma.

detailed_description.textblock:
To investigate, using optical coherence tomography angiography, early retinal vascular features 48 hours after ocular trauma and to detect their changes during 6 months' follow up.
The optical coherence tomography angiography represents a novel and noninvasive diagnostic technique that allows a detailed analysis of retinal vascular features.

primary_outcome.measure: The measurements of retinal vessel density in patients after ocular blunt trauma during 6 months's follow up
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the changes in retinal vessel density in 18 patients, at baseline and 1, 3, 6 months after ocular blunt trauma, using optical coherence tomography angiography. The parameter analyzed by optical coherence tomography angiography was: retinal vessel density

arm_group.description: Patients with previous ocular blunt trauma in one eye.
Healthy fellow eyes without actual and previous ocular trauma

intervention.description: Patients underwent non-invasive, fast, diagnostic imaging technique (optical coherence tomography angiography)

study_pop.textblock: The participans were older than 40 years with diagnosis of previous ocular blunt trauma. They did not present other ophthalmological diseases.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age older than 40 years
- diagnosis of previous ocular blunt trauma
- absence of previous ocular surgery, congenital eye disease, high myopia (>6 dioptres), actual or previous diagnosis of glaucoma, optic disc anomaly, macular or vitreoretinal diseases.
- absence of significant lens opacities, low-quality OCT and OCT-A images.
Exclusion Criteria:
- age younger than 40 years
- absence of previous ocular blunt trauma
- presence of previous ocular surgery, congenital eye disease, high myopia (>6 dioptres), actual or previous diagnosis of glaucoma, optic disc anomaly, macular or vitreoretinal diseases.
- presence of significant lens opacities, low-quality OCT and OCT-A images.
